intro: Huernia keniensis var. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan moon cactus, is a succulent plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and spiny, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and ability to store water make it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation. It thrives in full sun and requires minimal watering, making it ideal for low-maintenance gardening.
